name: 60g Protein Banana Pancake
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth
Heat non-stick pan over medium heat
Pour batter and cook for 2-3 minutes per side
Flip when bubbles form on surface

name: Brookie Protein Cookie Dough Cup
instructions: Mix all dry ingredients except cocoa powder, add milk and vanilla to form dough
Split dough in half
Add cocoa powder to one half to make brownie dough
In small bowl: place cookie dough on bottom, brownie dough on top
Melt dark chocolate and spread over top
Refrigerate for 2-4 hours before serving

name: High Protein Cinnamon Bites
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt
Add Greek yogurt and mix until dough forms
Divide into 10 equal balls
Coat lightly with cooking spray or egg wash
Bake for 13-15 minutes until golden

name: Protein Cinnamon Churro Bites
instructions: Mix flour and Greek yogurt to form dough
Add vanilla extract and knead until smooth
Roll dough into small balls
Air fry at 375°F for 6-8 minutes until golden
Mix cinnamon and sweetener in a bowl
Coat warm bites in cinnamon mixture and serve

name: Lemon Cheesecake Protein Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F
Mix almond flour and melted butter, press into 8x8 pan
Bake crust for 8 minutes
Blend cream cheese, Greek yogurt, lemon juice, and protein powder
Pour filling over baked crust
Bake for 20 minutes until set
Chill for 2 hours before slicing into 8 bars

name: Pizza Protein Bagel Bites
ingredients: 2 Greek yogurt mini bagels (homemade: 1 cup flour + 1 cup Greek yogurt)
instructions: If making bagels: Mix flour and yogurt, shape into 4 mini bagels, bake at 375°F for 20 min
Slice mini bagels in half
Spread marinara sauce on each half
Top with mozzarella cheese
Add pepperoni minis
Broil for 2-3 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly

name: Almond Joy Protein Cups
instructions: Mix coconut yogurt with chocolate whey protein until smooth
Place silicone cupcake molds on a tray
Spoon yogurt mixture into molds, filling halfway
Sprinkle almond slivers on top
Drizzle with melted sugar-free chocolate
Freeze for 1 hour until firm
Pop out of molds and store in freezer

name: High-Protein Pretzel Nuggets
instructions: Mix flour and Greek yogurt to form dough
Knead until smooth and elastic
Shape dough into small nugget pieces
Brush each nugget with beaten egg wash
Sprinkle generously with coarse salt
Air fry at 375°F for 8 minutes until golden brown
Serve warm

name: Peanut Butter Banana Protein Bars
instructions: Mash bananas in a large bowl
Mix in peanut butter powder and protein powder
Fold in rolled oats until well combined
Press mixture firmly into an 8x8 pan lined with parchment
Refrigerate for 2 hours until firm
Slice into 8 bars
Store in refrigerator

name: Brownie Batter Protein Dip
instructions: Add all ingredients to a bowl
Mix until creamy and smooth
Adjust consistency with more almond milk if needed
Chill in refrigerator until ready to serve
Serve with fresh fruit, pretzels, or graham crackers
Store in refrigerator up to 3 days

name: Strawberry Cheesecake Protein Cups
instructions: Whip Greek yogurt and light cream cheese together until smooth
Add vanilla protein powder and mix well
Fold in crushed strawberries
Divide mixture into 6 small cups or silicone molds
Chill in refrigerator for 2 hours to set
Store in refrigerator up to 4 days

name: Cottage Cheese Nacho Dip
instructions: Add cottage cheese and taco seasoning to blender
Blend until smooth and creamy
Transfer to serving bowl
Swirl salsa into the cottage cheese mixture
Serve with bell pepper strips, cucumber slices, or baked tortilla chips
Store in refrigerator up to 3 days

name: Salted Peanut Butter Protein Fudge
instructions: Melt peanut butter and coconut oil together
Mix in vanilla protein powder until smooth
Add pinch of sea salt and stir
Pour into small tray lined with parchment
Freeze for 1 hour until solid
Cut into 12 pieces
Store in freezer

name: Apple Pie Protein Oats Bars
instructions: Cook oats with almond milk until thick
Add diced apples and cinnamon, cook 3-4 minutes
Mix in cinnamon protein powder
Press mixture firmly into 8x8 pan
Chill in refrigerator for 2 hours
Slice into 8 bars
Store in refrigerator

name: Chocolate Covered Protein Strawberries
instructions: Mix chocolate protein powder, cocoa powder, and almond milk
Stir until smooth chocolate coating forms (add more milk if too thick)
Dip each strawberry into chocolate protein coating
Place dipped strawberries on parchment-lined tray
Refrigerate for 30 minutes until coating sets
Serve chilled (3 strawberries per serving)
Best consumed within 24 hours

name: Protein Ranch Pretzel Bites
instructions: Mix flour and Greek yogurt to form dough
Knead dough until smooth
Roll dough and cut into small pretzel bite pieces
Brush each piece with beaten egg wash
Sprinkle ranch seasoning over bites
Air fry at 375°F for 8-10 minutes until golden
Serve warm

name: High-Protein Cinnamon Swirl Rice Cakes
instructions: Mix Greek yogurt with vanilla protein powder
Add 1 tsp cinnamon to yogurt mixture
Spread protein cinnamon yogurt frosting on each rice cake
Dust with extra cinnamon on top
Serve immediately or refrigerate
Best consumed within 2 hours

name: High Protein Mini Pepperoni Pizza
ingredients: 1 cup Oat flour or almond flour (add more for thicker dough)
1/4 cup Mini pepperoni (or chopped regular pepperoni)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Blend cottage cheese and eggs until smooth using a stick blender
Stir in oat flour, baking powder, and salt until combined
The texture should be thick but scoopable—add a bit more oat flour if it's too runny
Spoon batter into 6 small rounds on the baking sheet and flatten slightly to form mini pizza bases
Top each with a spoon of pizza sauce, mozzarella, cheddar, and pepperoni
Add oregano or chili flakes if desired
Bake 15-20 minutes until lightly golden and set
Cool for a few minutes before serving to firm up

name: Egg White Clouds
ingredients: Optional: 1-2 drops vanilla extract or sweetener for flavor
instructions: Preheat oven to 225°F (110°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Separate egg whites into a clean, grease-free bowl
Add cream of tartar and a pinch of salt
Beat egg whites on medium speed until soft peaks form
Increase to high speed and beat until stiff, glossy peaks form (5-7 minutes)
Add optional vanilla or sweetener during last minute of beating if desired
Spoon or pipe meringue mixture onto prepared baking sheet in cloud-like mounds
Bake for 60-90 minutes until clouds are dry and crisp on the outside
Turn off oven and let clouds cool inside for 1 hour
Store in an airtight container for up to 3 days

name: Oreo Dirtcakes
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine Greek yogurt, protein powder, pudding mix, Laughing Cow cheese, sweetener, and salt
Mix until thick and pudding-like
Crush the Catalina Crunch cookies (without the cream)
Fold ¾ of the crushed cookies into the mixture, leaving a little to add on top
Top with the remaining crushed cookies and gummy worms
Refrigerate until ready to serve

name: High-Protein Cottage Cheese Cake Bars
ingredients: ½ cup oats (whole or blended into oat flour)
1–2 tbsp sugar-free maple syrup or honey (optional)
2–3 tbsp milk or water (adjust for batter consistency)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and line a small loaf pan or two ramekins with parchment paper
Blend cottage cheese until completely smooth
Whisk together blended cottage cheese, nut butter, maple syrup (if using), and vanilla extract
Add whey protein, oats (or oat flour), baking powder, and salt; mix until just combined
Gradually add milk or water until the batter is thick but spreadable
Fold in dark chocolate chips
Spoon batter into ramekins and smooth the top
Bake for 18–22 minutes, or until edges are golden and a toothpick comes out clean or slightly moist
Cool completely before removing; they firm up as they cool

name: High Protein Cinnamon Bread Sticks
ingredients: ½ scoop vanilla ice cream protein powder (EHP Labs or similar)
instructions: Preheat oven to 390°F
Blend all ingredients except cinnamon until smooth
Pour half the batter into a lightly lined loaf pan
Sprinkle half the cinnamon on top and swirl it in with a knife
Add the remaining batter on top, then sprinkle the rest of the cinnamon and swirl again
Bake for 12 minutes, then let rest before serving
Slice into 6 pieces if desired

name: High Protein Oreo Fluff
ingredients: 1 cup vanilla Greek yogurt (nonfat or low-fat)
instructions: In a bowl, mix Greek yogurt, protein powder, and sugar-free Jello mix until smooth and thick
Fold in the sugar-free Cool Whip until fully combined
Crush Oreo Thins and mix in, saving a little for garnish if desired
Chill for 15–20 minutes before serving for best texture
